title: Automating Shopify Product Tagging Using AI + Workflow Logic
summary: Reduced tagging workload by 90% using AI-powered taxonomy mapping and n8n automation.
problem: Manual tagging caused inconsistency, human error, slow publishing speed, and high operational cost.
solution: Built an LLM-powered tagging engine with a normalization layer and human-in-the-loop review process.
result: Achieved 90% reduction in manual work and improved product taxonomy consistency across the store.

sections.title: 1. Context / Background
paragraphs: The client maintains a large Shopify store with hundreds of health and biohacking products.
Their team manually assigned tags used for filters, SEO, and categorization. The process was slow, inconsistent, and dependent on subjective judgment.

sections.title: 2. The Problem
paragraphs: Manual tagging caused inconsistency, human error, missed tags, and slow publishing speed.
Without a consistent taxonomy, scaling the store’s operations became nearly impossible.

sections.title: 3. Discovery / Analysis
paragraphs: Shopify does not have native auto-tagging; tagging must be handled externally.
Product descriptions vary heavily, requiring AI to understand meaning, not just detect keywords.
The system needed a controlled vocabulary and a human review workflow.

sections.title: 4. The Solution
paragraphs: I built an automation system that extracts product titles, descriptions, and attributes.
AI interprets the product’s meaning, maps results to a defined taxonomy, and outputs normalized tags.
The n8n workflow updates Google Sheets automatically and prepares tags for Shopify import.

sections.title: 5. Architecture Overview
paragraphs: The workflow processes raw data → LLM tag inference → normalization → output formatting → optional Shopify API integration.

sections.title: 6. Results / Impact
paragraphs: Achieved a 90% reduction in manual tagging time.
Established consistent taxonomy and faster publishing workflow.
Created a scalable, repeatable tagging system ready for automated Shopify API integration.

sections.title: 7. Lessons / Insights
paragraphs: AI must understand behavior, not just keywords.
Human review remains essential for edge cases.
Automation removes grunt work and elevates editorial quality.
